abstract: Military duty in particular — but also other professions that require people to travel a lot or work away from home for long periods of time— can put serious strains on marriages and family life. If you or your spouse is in such a role, how do you make your family life work?
lead_paragraph: David H. Petraeus and his wife, Holly, and their two grown children had “long been viewed by military families as an inspiration, a model for making a marriage work despite the separation and hardship of long deployments overseas,” wrote Scott Shane and Sheryl Gay Stolberg in an article about the rise and fall of Gen. Petraeus, who resigned as director of the Central Intelligence Agency on Friday after admitting to an extramarital affair.

headline.main: When a Spouse Is Posted Abroad
